member.name: IUIAnimationInterpolator2.GetDependencies
member.summary: For the given dimension, GetDependencies retrieves the aspects of the interpolator that depend on the initial value or velocity that is passed to the method or the duration that is passed to the method.
member.param: Aspects of the interpolator that depend on the initial value passed to .
Aspects of the interpolator that depend on the initial velocity passed to .
Aspects of the interpolator that depend on the duration passed to .
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationInterpolator2.GetDimension
member.summary: Gets the number of dimensions that require interpolation.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationInterpolator2.GetDuration
member.summary: Gets the duration of a transition for the given dimension.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationInterpolator2.GetFinalValue
member.summary: Gets the final value at the end of the transition for the given dimension.
member.param: The dimension from which to retrieve the final value.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationInterpolator2.GetPrimitiveInterpolation
member.summary: Generates a primitive interpolation of the specified animation curve.
member.param: The object that defines the custom animation curve information.
The dimension in which to apply the new segment.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationInterpolator2.InterpolateValue
member.summary: Interpolates the value of an animation variable at the specified offset and for the given dimension.

param.name: offset
param.para: The offset from the start of the transition.
This parameter is always greater than or equal to zero and less than the duration of the transition. This method is not called if the duration of the transition is zero.

member.param: The dimension in which to interpolate the value.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationInterpolator2.InterpolateVelocity
member.summary: Interpolates the velocity, or rate of change, at the specified offset for the given dimension.

param.name: offset
param.para: The offset from the start of the transition.
The offset is always greater than or equal to zero and less than or equal to the duration of the transition. This method is not called if the duration of the transition is zero.

member.param: The dimension in which to interpolate the velocity.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationInterpolator2.SetDuration
member.summary: Sets the duration of the transition in the given dimension.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationInterpolator2.SetInitialValueAndVelocity
member.summary: Sets the initial value and velocity of the transition for the given dimension.
member.param: The dimension in which to set the initial value or velocity of the transition.
member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise an HRESULT error code. See Windows Animation Error Codes for a list of error codes.

member.name: IUIAnimationInterpolator2
member.summary: Extends the interface that defines methods for creating a custom interpolator. IUIAnimationInterpolator2 supports interpolation in a given dimension.
